Class Chunk

  • java.lang.Object

        float damage

      • height

        int height
        Terrain height

      • c_height

        int c_height
        Terrain height modified for corruption spread
        When part of a diagonal edge (diagonalEdges) c_height represents height of the lower half of the edge.
        All creeper updates and edge detection uses c_height instead of height and this allows it to partially flood terrain edges (which removes visual gaps in-between terrain and corruption edges).

      • edgeLowerHeight

        int edgeLowerHeight
        The offset between height and c_height. Tells what terrain layer is the lower terrain part of the edge.
        Example: An edge between height 5 and 2. Height is 5, edgeLowerHeight is (5-2) 3 and thus c_height is (height - edgeLowerHeight) 2.

      • diagonalEdges

        public java.util.List<Chunk.EdgeType> diagonalEdges
        List of all Chunk.EdgeTypes that are considered diagonal and creeper may partially flow into the chunk

        boolean terrainEdge
        Flags this tile as a terrain edge

      • neighbours

        Chunk[] neighbours
        Array of surrounding neighbour chunks.
        neighbours[0] = plusy;
        neighbours[1] = cornerTopRight;
        neighbours[2] = plusx;
        neighbours[3] = cornerBottomRight;
        neighbours[4] = minusy;
        neighbours[5] = cornerBottomLeft;
        neighbours[6] = minusx;
        neighbours[7] = cornerTopLeft;

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public boolean update()
        Current corruption update method, creeper is distributed along the tiles with lower creeper in relation to the difference from this chunks creeper. The resulting creeper level changes are saved into respectable creeperChange variables and the actual creeper is set later using the applyUpdate() method. This is done to remove an axial bias in the direction of the subsequent updates.
        Returns:
        Returns whether an actual corruption update happened or not, used for optimisation.

      • averageCreeper

        private void averageCreeper(float thisTotal,
                            Chunk to)

      • applyUpdate

        public void applyUpdate()
        Called after all the other Chunks had been updated using the update() method in the current simulation tick

      • getTerrainTexture

        public AtlasRegionContainer getTerrainTexture()
        Returns an AtlasRegionContainer representing this Chunks terrain. The container contains edge resolved combined textures.
        See Also:
        TerrainEdgeResolver

      • getCorruptionTexture

        public AtlasRegionContainer getCorruptionTexture()
        Returns the appropriate corruption texture of this Chunk. Does all necessary edge checks and returns null when needed.
        Since:
        v5.0 (30.11.18)
        The tile texture resolve rewritten to use a single mesh on a single layer. Edges are not resolved by layer anymore. Before, there were Base.MAX_CREEP individual meshes for every Section. So multiple corruption layers were rendered on top of each other (with culling). By unifying all these meshes into a single textured mesh performance will increase (We no longer need to cycle all chunks multiple times). This change was allowed because of the usage of a glsl shader that combines multiple textures within a single draw.
        See Also:
        resolveCorruptionEdges()

      • resolveCorruptionEdges

        private AtlasRegionContainer resolveCorruptionEdges()
        Returns the appropriate edge AtlasRegionContainer. AtlasRegionContainer allows us to return multiple textures in a certain order. It can also hold a special secondary shade value (AtlasRegionContainer.getSecondaryShade()) As of right now the corruption renderer and shader supports 2 individual textures that can be overlaid over each other. (Thats why there is just one secondary shade value). The edges are resolved using the same resolver and method as the terrain itself. But the resolve algorithm is slightly modified.
        See Also:
        TerrainEdgeResolver

      • generateCorruptionDiffs

        private TerrainEdgeInfo generateCorruptionDiffs(int compareTo)
        Generates corruption heigh difference masks that can be passed to TerrainEdgeResolver.

        public void updateNeighbour()

      • setCreeperLevel

        public void setCreeperLevel(float newCreeper)
        Sets the creeper and absCreeper values. Also makes sure the creeper is within it's bounds. It makes sure the creeper doesn't exceed the Base.MAX_CREEP value with respect to this chunks terrain height.
        Parameters:
        newCreeper - The new creeper value

      • getCreeperLevel

        public float getCreeperLevel()
        Returns:
        Current creeper level.

      • getAbsoluteCreeperLevel

        public float getAbsoluteCreeperLevel()
        Returns the combined value of creeper and height.
        Returns:
        Current absCreeper level.

      • getAbsoluteCreeperLayer

        public int getAbsoluteCreeperLayer()
        Returns the getAbsoluteCreeperLevel() value but its rounded to the closest lower integer. This represents the creeper "layer". If there is no creeper -1 will be returned.
        Returns:
        The getAbsoluteCreeperLevel() value cast to an int.

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(int level)

      • setTerrainEdge

        public void setTerrainEdge(boolean edge,
                           int lowerLevel,
                           Chunk.EdgeType edgetype)
        Flag/Unflag this Chunk as a terrain edge.
        Parameters:
        edge - Edge boolean.
        lowerLevel - Height difference between the topmost and lowest layer heights in this edge.
        edgetype - Type of this edge.
        See Also:
        Chunk.EdgeType
